sect1.title: Managing LDAP users and groups
sect1.para: Users and groups are created and managed with the dsidm command.
The following examples use the instance name LDAP1. Replace this with your instance name.
List your existing users and groups:
sect1.screen: &prompt.sudo;dsidm LDAP1 user list &prompt.sudo;dsidm LDAP1 group list
sect1.para: List all information on a single user:

procedure.title: Creating LDAP groups and assigning users to them
procedure.para: In the following examples, we create a group, server_admins, and assign the user &exampleuserII; to this group. The example server instance is named LDAP1, and the instance's suffix is dc=LDAP1,dc=COM.

step.para: You will be prompted for a group name. Enter your chosen group name, which in the following example is SERVER_ADMINS:
Add the user &exampleuserII; to the group:
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;dsidm LDAP1 group add_member SERVER_ADMINS \ uid=&exampleuserII_plain;,ou=people,dc=LDAP1,dc=COM added member: uid=&exampleuserII_plain;,ou=people,dc=LDAP1,dc=COM
